#Text=Chapter 1
#Text=As he guided the black BMW coupe onto Highway 280 , Matthew Locke felt as though his mind was spinning as quickly as the wheels propelling him onward .
#Text=Whether the one functioned as precisely as the other did not occur to him .
#Text=Appraising his position , he wondered why there were so few cars to contend with this afternoon .
#Text=Having lived in Northern California for more than two years , he had never headed home on 280 without confronting ricocheting tail lights , jockeying for position in the fast lane .
#Text=Bright sunlight and warm air rushed through the sunroof and windows as he gained speed and activated the cruise control upon reaching sixty-five miles per hour .
#Text=Then Matthew noticed the clock , and he remembered he was two hours ahead of the commuter traffic that congested the highway every day .
#Text=He also remembered why .
#Text=He took a few deep breaths to relax his nerves .
#Text=He had tried one last time , to no avail , to compromise with Peter Jones , the stubborn young founder of Wallaby Computer , Incorporated .
#Text=Matthew Locke did not want things to end like this .
#Text=Not exactly .
#Text=But there was no alternative .

#Text=The confrontation that had just taken place was more like a vicious counseling session between a distressed married couple than a meeting between two senior executives of the decade 's most important and innovative high technology company .
#Text=Matthew had informed his secretary Eileen that he was walking over to Peter Jones 's office to try to talk with him one last time about the upcoming board of directors meeting .
#Text=As Matthew neared Peter 's building , his anxiety sharpened .
#Text=He paused for a moment and thought about his place at that very instant , standing at the very center of the Peter Jones legacy .
#Text=Surrounding Matthew were a number of Spanish-style , single-story buildings , each painted white and topped with a red tile roof .

#Text=What began as a seedling idea in a garage nearly a decade ago had blossomed into the cluster of buildings stretching a quarter-mile in either direction from where he stood , and even farther , to a number of locations throughout the world .
#Text=And now he was on his way to the epicenter of this campus-like complex that was Wallaby Computer .
#Text=Matthew arrived from his journey west with the feeling that he had entered a fairy tale , so full of wonder was this place .
#Text=But now , as he resumed his step along the gently curving sidewalk that ran up either side of the block , he felt as though the set were changing .
#Text=Full of dread , he approached the end , and the beginning , of the rainbow , where he would confront the man " Time " magazine called the " Computer Wizard .

#Text= Nobody 's home , " Peter repeated over the sound of his staccato typing .

column1: #Text=Matthew eased himself into the chair beside the couch , remembering the first time he had sat in this very office , more than two years ago , when Jones had hired him to run the company .
#Text=My God , Matthew thought , how he has changed - how everything has changed .
#Text=All at once , the room was silent .
#Text=Peter Jones turned around in his chair .
#Text=One thing had not changed : Peter 's eyes .
#Text=Deep and black and seemingly bottomless , certain and sharply focused , like the eyes of a young boy determined to win a swimming race .

#Text=Matthew felt his toes grip at nothingness inside his dock shoes , felt his feet slide silently backward a fraction of an inch across the natty carpet , as if he were taking a step back from the edge of the board for fear of diving once again into that dark pool .
#Text=And with this thought came another ... of water , and splashing , thrashing , losing grip ... Loss .
#Text=Determined , Matthew quickly sobered himself of the troubling memories that had momentarily distorted his focus .
#Text=He stood .
#Text=" Peter , unless you and I can come to some understanding about how we 're going to run the business , I 'm going to suggest some drastic changes at tomorrow 's board meeting .

#Text= There 'll be some changes , all right , " Peter said .

column1: #Text=The gravity of the younger man 's tone went unnoticed by Matthew .
#Text=His attention had been captured by what he 'd seen on the screen before it darkened .
#Text=It appeared that Peter was working on some sort of graphic .
#Text=A drawing with little boxes .
#Text=Probably a sketch of a new computer design , Matthew concluded .

#Text=The pang of pity he felt changed to frustration when he recognized the root of the problem : Why ca n't he understand that this is exactly what he should be doing , designing new computers , and let me run the company ?
